H0.text: Fall is the season when the Northern Hemisphere is pointed away from the Sun, as Jamal lives in the Northern Hemisphere.

H1.text: Spring is the season when the Northern Hemisphere is pointed away from the Sun for a person living in the Northern Hemisphere, such as Jamal.

H2.text: Summer is the season when the Northern Hemisphere is pointed away from the Sun, as in the scenario where Jamal lives in the Northern Hemisphere.

H3.text: Winter is the season when the Northern Hemisphere is pointed away from the Sun, as is the case for Jamal who lives in the Northern Hemisphere.

A4.text: Because of seasonal lag, June, July, and August are the warmest months in the Northern Hemisphere while December, January, and February are the warmest months in the Southern Hemisphere.

A5.text: the Northern Hemisphere and Southern Hemisphere always experience opposite seasons. This is because during summer or winter, one part of the planet is more directly exposed to the rays of the Sun than the other, and this exposure alternates as the Earth revolves in its orbit.
